recipe_text: Quantity; 450; Prepare 450 grams of ground beef| Measurement; 150; Measure out 150 grams of onion, chopped| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 480; Measure out 480 grams of sloppy joe sauce| Measurement; 200; Measure out 200 grams of frozen corn| Measurement; 200; Measure out 200 grams of cheddar cheese, shredded| Measurement; 300; Measure out 300 grams of biscuit dough| Untimed; None; Preheat oven to 200 degrees C (400 degrees F)| Untimed; None; In a skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until beef is browned| Untimed; None; Drain excess fat and stir in sloppy joe sauce and frozen corn| Untimed; None; Transfer mixture to a baking dish| Untimed; None; Sprinkle cheddar cheese over the top| Untimed; None; Arrange biscuit dough pieces over the cheese| Timed; 1800; Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until biscuits are golden brown| Finish; None; Serve hot and enjoy!
title: Sloppy Joe Casserole
